children.name: plan
children.definition: a set of actions for achieving sth in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail: kế hoạch
examples: COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'do a plan'. Saymake a plan.

children.name: have a plan
examples: Don’t worry – I have a plan.

children.name: make plans
children.definition: prepare for something
examples: Mary has been busy making plans for her wedding.

children.name: come up with a plan
children.definition: think of a plan
examples: The chairman must come up with a plan to get the club back on its feet.

children.name: devise/formulate/draw up a plan
children.definition: make a detailed plan, especially after considering something carefully
examples: He devised a daring plan to steal two million dollars.|The company has already drawn up plans to develop the site.

children.name: carry out a plan
children.definition: do what has been planned
examples: The bombers were arrested by the security forces before they could carry out their plans.

children.name: keep to/stick to a plan
examples: We’re sticking to our original plan.

children.name: abandon/scrap a plan
children.definition: decide not to continue with it
examples: The plan was scrapped because it was too expensive.

children.name: announce/unveil a plan
children.definition: officially tell people about it
examples: The government unveiled its plans for a shake-up of the health system.

children.name: approve a plan
examples: The plan was approved at a board meeting on 24 December.

children.name: reject a plan
examples: The plan was rejected on the grounds that it would cost too much money.

children.name: outline a plan
children.definition: describe it in a general way
examples: They listened as he outlined his plan.

children.name: implement a planformal
children.definition: to do what has been agreed as part of an official plan
examples: To implement its plans, the company has entered into a partnership with another software developer.

children.name: shelve a plan
children.definition: not continue with it, although you might continue with it later
examples: The plans will be shelved until an alternative access to the site can be found.

children.name: ambitious
examples: The plan was very ambitious, but it worked.

children.name: detailed
examples: The generals drew up detailed plans for the invasion.

children.name: cunning/clever/ingenious
examples: They devised a cunning plan to get back their money.|The gang devised a cunning plan to rob the bank.

children.name: a five-year/ten-year etc plan
examples: Unesco has a 25-year plan to provide basic education to all.

children.name: a grand plan
children.definition: a plan that involves doing a lot of things in order to achieve something big
examples: Marrying the countess was all part of his grand plan.

children.name: a master plan
children.definition: a detailed plan for dealing with a complicated situation
examples: The governors came up with a master plan for saving the school.

children.name: a business plan
examples: We’ve developed a business plan to take over the company.

children.name: a peace plan
examples: Both sides have agreed to implement the UN peace plan.

children.name: a rescue plan
children.definition: a plan for saving a company, economy etc
examples: Which rescue plan offers the company the best prospects of survival?

children.name: an action plan
examples: My accountant developed a detailed action plan with specific targets.

children.name: go according to plan
children.definition: happen in the way that was arranged
examples: If everything goes according to plan, we’ll finish in January.

children.name: a plan of action
examples: Ministers are discussing a plan of action to deal with the crisis.

children.name: a plan of attack
children.definition: a plan to attack or achieve something
examples: At this stage, you go back to the office and work on a plan of attack.

children.name: a plan of campaignBritish English
children.definition: a plan to achieve something
examples: What we need now is a plan of campaign.

children.name: plan for
examples: The chairman outlined the company’s plans for achieving a 10% growth in sales.

children.name: plan to do something
examples: There are plans to turn the site of the factory into a park.

children.name: plan A/plan Buse this when you are saying that you have two possible plans, in case the first one is not successful
examples: Plan A obviously wasn’t going to work, so we had to resort to plan B.

children.name: strategy
children.definition: a carefully designed plan for achieving something that is difficult and may take a long time: chiến lược
examples: the government’s long-term economic strategy
strategy for doing something
a strategy for dealing with crime
strategy to do something
a strategy to attract younger audiences to jazz
strategy of
The rebels’ strategy of guerrilla warfare has been remarkably successful.

children.name: an economic strategy
examples: The government has changed its economic strategy.

children.name: a business strategy
examples: This is a high-risk business strategy.

children.name: a marketing strategy
examples: The firm is considering a change in its marketing strategy.

children.name: a political strategy
examples: Baldwin’s political strategy was almost totally successful.

children.name: a coping strategy
examples: Therapists can show a child new coping strategies.

children.name: a survival strategy
examples: He says his father’s withdrawal was a survival strategy.

children.name: a successful/effective strategy
examples: The most successful strategy is often the simplest one.

children.name: a clear/coherent strategy
examples: It is important that the company has a clear strategy.

children.name: a high-risk strategy
examples: The expansion plan is a high-risk strategy.

children.name: a long-term strategy
examples: The closure of these branches is part of our long-term strategy.

children.name: use a strategy
children.definition: alsoemploy a strategyformal
examples: What strategies do you use to deal with these problems?

children.name: adopt a strategy
children.definition: start to use it
examples: Both players adopted the same strategy.

children.name: devise/work out a strategy
children.definition: alsoformulate a strategyformal
examples: We had to devise strategies for saving money.

children.name: develop a strategy
examples: Groups can help members develop new coping strategies.

children.name: evolve a strategy
examples: The creatures which live in the river have evolved strategies for surviving sudden floods.

children.name: pursue/follow a strategy
children.definition: do a particular planned series of actions
examples: They are pursuing different strategies.

children.name: implement a strategyformal
children.definition: do a series of actions that you or someone else has planned
examples: The firm faces several challenges as it seeks to implement that strategy.

children.name: a strategy works
examples: The Government’s economic strategy was not working.

children.name: programmeBritish /programAmerican
children.definition: a series of activities, organized by a government or other large organization, that is designed to achieve something important and will continue for a long time: chương trình
examples: the US space program
programme to do sth
a United Nations programme to control the spread of AIDS
programme of
a programme of economic reforms
The irrigation project is part of a programme of aid to West Africa.
launch a programme
The government has launched a programme to help unemployed young people find work.
a training/research/space etc programme
It’s a major research program, aimed at developing cheaper fuels.

children.name: an economic programme
examples: The party did not have a clear economic programme.

children.name: a development programme
examples: This project is a central part of the development programme for the area.

children.name: a reform programme
examples: After the elections, they embarked on an ambitious reform programme.

children.name: an expansion programme
examples: The company’s aggressive expansion program will double the size of the chain in the next four years.

children.name: a building programme
examples: We will continue with our hospital building programme.

children.name: a spending programme
examples: The government’s spending programme is the subject of vigorous debate.

children.name: the space programme
children.definition: for sending vehicles into space
examples: He was involved in the Soviet space programme.

children.name: a major/massive programme
examples: A major programme of modernisation is transforming public transport in London.

children.name: an ambitious programme
examples: The European Community embarked on an ambitious programme of research.

children.name: embark on/launch a programme
children.definition: start it
examples: The company has embarked on an expansion programme.

children.name: carry out a programme
children.definition: alsoimplement a programmeformal
examples: They attempted to implement a programme of reform.

children.name: plan of action
children.definition: / game planinformala detailed plan explaining exactly how to achieve something: kế hoạch hành động
examples: ▪ Here’s my game plan, Roger. I want to make the magazine a monthly, and cut it down to sixty or seventy pages.

children.name: decide/devise/put forward etc a plan of action
examples: ▪ If the problem continues, discuss a plan of action with your colleagues.

children.name: policy
children.definition: a plan or set of principles agreed by the members of a government, a political group, a company etc, that says how they intend to deal with a particular subject or problem: chính sách
examples: It is not our policy to reveal our clients’ names.
policy on/towards
government policy on higher education
US policy towards China
the government’s policy on Europe
The Cuban revolution resulted in a reassessment of Washington’s policy towards the Third World generally.
policy of
A new ruler might adopt a policy of drastically cutting back oil production in order to boost prices.
it is (sb’s) policy to do sth
It is hospital policy to screen all mothers with certain risk factors.

children.name: government/public/state policy
examples: Government spending is determined by government policy.

children.name: party policy
examples: State ownership is party policy.

children.name: company/hospital/university etc policy
examples: It is not company policy to offer refunds.

children.name: foreign policy
examples: Support for human rights is a key element in our foreign policy.

children.name: economic/fiscal policy
examples: The middle classes have suffered most as a result of government economic policies.

children.name: defence/energy/housing etc policy
examples: Our energy policies must put the environment first.

children.name: a deliberate policy
examples: Some customers pursue a deliberate policy of delaying payment.

children.name: a clear policy
examples: There was no clear policy on this matter.

children.name: a coherent policy
children.definition: one in which all the parts of the policy work well together
examples: A long-term coherent policy for industry is needed.

children.name: formulate/develop a policy
examples: We try to formulate policies that will meet the needs of the people.

children.name: make policy
children.definition: decide what it will be
examples: A committee of representatives makes policy.

children.name: shape policy
children.definition: develop it or have an influence on it
examples: These terrorist acts will not be allowed to shape our foreign policy.

children.name: adopt a policy
children.definition: use one
examples: He adopted a policy of radical reform.

children.name: implement a policy
children.definition: take action in the way that has been decided
examples: Local government is responsible for implementing central government policy.

children.name: pursue/follow a policy
children.definition: continue with a policy over a period of time
examples: The organization is pursuing a policy of cost cutting.

children.name: reverse a policy
children.definition: stop a policy and change it
examples: The new government set about reversing previous policies.

children.name: a policy aims at something/to do something
children.definition: tries to achieve something
examples: The policy aimed to reduce the budget deficit.

children.name: a policy decision
examples: No policy decision can be made until the next meeting.

children.name: a policy statement
examples: There has been no policy statement on this from the French government.

children.name: a policy change
examples: There have been numerous policy changes in recent months.

children.name: a policy issue
examples: He rarely consulted him on general policy issues.

children.name: a policy maker
children.definition: someone who decides on what it should be
examples: Policy makers have not dealt with the issue very effectively.

children.name: a policy objective
examples: How can we best achieve our policy objectives?

children.name: a policy initiative
children.definition: something done to achieve a policy's goals
examples: The policy initiatives have focused on the inner cities.

children.name: a change of/in policy
examples: This decision represented a major change in policy.

children.name: a shift in policy
children.definition: a small change
examples: The shift in policy placed more emphasis on teachers' assessments of students' progress.

children.name: a reversal of policy
children.definition: a change back to what it was before
examples: The strength of this opposition forced a rapid reversal of policy.

children.name: scheme/program American
children.definition: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training: kế hoạch
examples: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
scheme for
schemes for two new cross-city lines
scheme to do sth
a new scheme to boost exports

children.name: a major scheme
examples: The government is introducing a major housebuilding scheme in the area.

children.name: a new scheme
examples: The new scheme aims to reduce street crime by 30%.

children.name: an innovative scheme
children.definition: using new ideas
examples: an innovative scheme to help the unemployed get back to work

children.name: a grand scheme
children.definition: trying to achieve a lot
examples: In the end, the government’s grand scheme came to nothing.

children.name: a pilot scheme
children.definition: one that is tried on a small scale first to see if it is a good idea
examples: The programme was introduced into 100 primary schools in a very successful pilot scheme.

children.name: a training scheme
examples: The company runs an apprentice training scheme.

children.name: a pension scheme
examples: Does your employer offer a pension scheme?

children.name: a compensation/bonus etc scheme
children.definition: in which people receive compensation, a bonus etc
examples: a new compensation scheme for accident victims

children.name: an incentive scheme
children.definition: in which people receive money to persuade them to work harder
examples: There is a generous incentive scheme for the sales force.

children.name: introduce/launch a scheme
examples: The scheme was launched last autumn by the company’s education officer.

children.name: run/operate a scheme
examples: Parent volunteers help run the scheme.

children.name: be covered by a scheme
children.definition: be able to benefit from a scheme
examples: All employees are covered by the new bonus scheme.

children.name: blueprint
children.definition: a completely new plan for important changes or ways of dealing with a problem: bản kế hoạch chi tiết

children.name: blueprint for
examples: Conservation groups have suggested a blueprint for a ‘Green World’.
A panel of advisors is urging The White House to adopt a blueprint for dealing with such emergencies.

children.name: ways of saying that sth is being planned
in the pipeline
children.definition: be  if sth such as a new product or a change is in the pipeline, it is being planned and prepared and it will be ready soon: được soạn, lên kế hoạch, sắp được thông qua
examples: ▪ After considerable market research, several new products are now in the pipeline.
▪ There are one or two important changes in the pipeline.

children.name: in the planning stages U
children.definition: be in the planning stagesalsobe at the planning stageUK  if sth such as a product is in the planning stages, it is being planned, but the final details have not yet been decided: trong giai đoạn dự kiến, đang được lên kế hoạch
examples: A new museum is currently at the planning stage at Bowness.
The programme is only in the planning stages, and is not likely to be broadcast until next year.

children.name: afoot
children.definition: if sth new, interesting, strange, or dishonest is afoot, sb is planning it, especially secretly: đang tiến hành, đan được lên kế hoạch
examples: ▪ From information received, it was thought that some illegal activity was afoot.
▪ A quick look round the research and development facility in Versailles revealed a number of interesting software projects afoot.

children.name: plans/changes/moves etc are afoot
examples: ▪ Plans are now afoot for an important exhibition of Canaletto in England.
▪ Apparently, moves are afoot to ban smoking in public places.

children.name: arrangements
children.definition: arrangement plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen: sự sắp đặt, sắp xếp
examples: Have you made all your travel arrangements?

children.name: make arrangements
examples: You are advised to make travel arrangements well in advance.

children.name: discuss the arrangements
examples: We need to discuss the wedding arrangements.

children.name: finalize the arrangements
examples: I’m meeting him tomorrow to finalize the arrangements.

children.name: upset the arrangements
children.definition: cause problems which spoil the arrangements
examples: I don’t want to upset your arrangements.

children.name: alternative arrangements
examples: If the flight is cancelled you’ll have to make alternative arrangements.

children.name: special arrangements
children.definition: particular preparations other than those usually made
examples: Please inform us if any guests have disabilities or need any special arrangements.

children.name: security arrangements
examples: He was in charge of security arrangements for the President’s visit.

children.name: financial arrangements
examples: As treasurer, you’re responsible for all the financial arrangements.

children.name: travel arrangements
examples: I’ll make my own travel arrangements.

children.name: holiday arrangements
examples: British English We don’t have any holiday arrangements yet.

children.name: seating/sleeping arrangements
children.definition: plans for where people will sit/sleep
examples: What are the seating arrangements for dinner?

children.name: arrangement for
examples: I’ve agreed to help with arrangements for the party.
The family made arrangements for his body to be flown back.

children.name: take care of the arrangementsthu xếp, chuẩn bị cho
examples: Don’t worry about finding a place to stay. My department will take care of the arrangements.

children.name: arrangement
children.definition: sth that has been organized or agreed onSYN agreement: dàn xếp, tthoả thuận

children.name: arrangement between
examples: An arrangement between the two couples ensured there was always someone to look after the children.

children.name: arrangement with
examples: The school has an arrangement with local businesses.

children.name: an arrangement to do sth
examples: Maxine cancelled our arrangement to meet.

children.name: come to an/some arrangement (with sb)(= make an agreement that is acceptable to everyone )
examples: It would usually cost $500, but I’m sure we can come to some kind of arrangement.
Pets are permitted at the resortby prior arrangement.

children.name: itinerary
children.definition: noun hành trình

children.name: a detailed plan or route of a journey
examples: _The tour operator will arrange transport and plan your itinerary.

children.name: campaign
children.definition: a planned group of especially political, business or military activities which are intended to achieve a particular aim: chiến dịch, cuộc vận động.
examples: This is the latest act of terrorism in a long-standing and bloody campaignof violence.
She's the campaignorganizerfor the Labour Party.

campaign/kæmˈpeɪn/ [I verb] [C1] to work for a long time, for example making speeches, writing to newspapers and political representatives etc, in order to persuade people that something needs to be done : đi vận động
After months of campaigning, local parents have persuaded the council to provide a school bus service.
campaign for
Women campaigned for equal pay and equal rights throughout the 1960s.
campaign to do sth
He was one of the people who campaigned to change the law on homosexuality.
campaigner[C noun]
During his years as a human rights campaigner he was arrested seven times.

children.name: a vigorous campaign: a very strong campaign
examples: Clark’s vigorous campaign against the dumping of nuclear waste will continue.

children.name: campaign for/against
examples: the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament.
Our campaign against drug abuse is supported by the medical profession.

children.name: campaign to do sth
examples: The government’s campaign to recruit more black police officers has not been a success.

children.name: launch/mount a campaign
examples: Environmental groups launched a campaign against the widespread production of genetically modified crops.
The government have just launchedtheir annual Christmas campaigntostop drunken driving.

children.name: plan
children.definition: sth you have decided to do:
examples: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.

children.name: have plans
examples: I have no plans to retire yet.

children.name: change your plans
examples: We had to change our plans at the last minute.

children.name: abandon/give up your plans
examples: The city authorities have abandoned their plans to host the Super Bowl.

children.name: cancel your plans
examples: The weather got worse, and we had to cancel our plans to have the party outdoors.

children.name: shelve a plan
children.definition: cancel your plan, although you may do it later
examples: The plan had to be shelved because of lack of money.

children.name: a change of plan
examples: The day before my flight, my boss phoned and said there’d been a change of plan.

children.name: sb’s immediate plans
children.definition: what they are going to do next
examples: So what are your immediate plans after graduation?

children.name: the best planBritish English
children.definition: the best thing to do
examples: I think the best plan is to take the train.
